content.description: A classic face climb. Start on a block then transfer on to the face sustained to a finish on finger locks.

Short and entertaining climbing on decent rock. Boulder up the start climbing good holds with the occasional not-as-good hold to a horizontal break and less steep terrain. Finish up on smaller, less positive holds to the anchors.
content.location:
Between the well-chalked routes of

Hammer Time

and

Return of the Mohan

content.description: The wall's best line. It gets high accolades on redrivercimbing.com. Steep, fingery pocket pulling for most the entire way. Step up off the ground and get into the sustained pocket pulling through all five bolts. Some jugs show up just when you want them to get you to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chain anchors with lowering biners
content.location: Third route from the right side of the crag. Start in a short lieback crack and climb the chalked up line of pockets.

content.description: This is the first bolted route encountered on the main wall and also the less featured. Tweaky moves on small edges and shallow pockets lead to a steeper and more relaxed, though slightly odd, finish.
Mixed pro route (1 bolt) starting the crack left of Malignant and finishing in the crack at the top of Sundial. Can also do the bolted crux of Malignant then go left.
content.protection: Standard rack to BD #3, 1 bolt. No independent anchor, so either go left to Sundial or right to Malignant at the top. Also easy to set up a toprope from either anchor, clipping the bolt for a directional.
content.location: Crack start right of Sundial, left of Malignant

content.description: Climb up small edges and crimps on the slightly less than vertical wall. You will come to a small roof with what looks like little to no holds above it. Pull the roof on whatever you can find and continue to the anchors.
content.location: This route is on the vertical face to the left of the pocketed face you come up to on the approach trail. This is the second bolted route on that face.

content.description: Climb the crimpy face to a small crux near the roof to a easy ride to the top.
content.location: To the far left side of the crag there is a less than vertical face with two routes on it. This is the left one of those two lines.

content.description: A long, fun romp on great holds leads to a nice no-hands rest before the final bouldery moves to jugs to the anchor. Pull on finger jugs up past the very high first bolt. More finger jugs lead past two more bolts and to the fixed cable draw of the fourth bolt. Paw your way up into the no-hands rest in the corner. Rest up and swing out on huge jugs to the fifth clip. Smaller-than-youd-like holds get you up to the six bolt. Move right to an awesome jug hold on some sort of round intrusion feature and then another steep move or two the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chains with lowering biners
content.location: On the left end of the overhanging alcove area in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Excellent slab climbing up the quickly cleaning up face. Crux is near the beginning but mostly consistent at the grade.
content.location: The right most route on the slab on the left side of serenity point.

content.description: Pull the initial moves of undercut, slightly sandy rock. One established on the vertical face, move up while trending left a bit to gain the arête. Climbing the arête, or just right of it, past five or six bolts to a great recovery stance. Then pull up the steeper arête, past one great jug, to another small stance just before the final little headwall. Stay strong and finish up by moving left to the anchors.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchors with lowering links. Consider stick-clipping the high first bolt to protect initial moves.
content.location: The very obvious blunt arête towards the left end of the wall.

content.description: This line climbs up the slightly less than vertical face on good crimps. Power through the low crux to more relaxed climbing above.
content.location: On the far left side of this crag is two lines climbing a less than vertical face. This is the right of those two lines.

content.description: Tackle a low boulder problem that will test your lock off strength as you reach for a high crimp and shorties may find that they can't touch this. Regain your composure and finish the route up on a series of fun yet pumpy roof pulls.
content.location: Starts left of Hammer Time, just before the dihedral corner.

content.description: This line takes on the golden wall with long reaches between bullet pockets.  Undercling crux, good rest before last bolt, lay down rest to clip chains.
content.location: Just right of "Return of the Mojan".  Second bolted route from the climbers right side of the cliff.

content.description: Pockets and jugs with a well defined crux lead to enjoyable climbing for the last two bolts on the upper arête.
content.location: Starts 10 ft right of Hammer Time.
